01/27/11 05:03 PM ET Rep. Mike Pence ( R-Ind.) will not make a bid for the GOP presidential nomination in 2012, telling supporters in a letter that he would rather serve the state of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence wrote, Still, Mike Pence is not officially jumping into the race for Indiana governor just yet. The congressman said he expects to make a decision "later this year" about his next step

that seemed to holler to all their doubters, "Take that!" "We just wanted to show the whole world we could play together," Carmelo Anthony said after the duo's triumphant debut Monday night. We know there's a lot of doubt about that. Carmelo Anthony scored 28 points in his return from a 15-game suspension for fighting and Allen Iverson added 23 in the Denver Nuggets' 115-98 rout of the Memphis Grizzlies. The two are out to prove two superstars can coexist.
